content:
This SOP describes the procedure for ‘Acceptance sampling according to AQL’ used as a last instance to solve disputes regarding nonconforming products between JYSK and suppliers.

content:
JYSK can apply the described acceptance sampling procedure for any type of inspection according to JYSK General Requirements in case of unsolvable dispute.

If the deciding inspection is carried out as first-hand inspections at JYSK Distribution Centers, duly authorized representatives for both JYSK C&Q and the supplier must participate until a conclusion is reached.

If the deciding inspection is carried out by third party, JYSK C&Q and the supplier must agree on which third party inspector(s) to use before initiating the deciding inspection.

The sampling method must be according to Table 1.

| Sampling method                                                | According to ISO 2859-1 ¢ General inspection level II e Single sampling plans for normal inspections                                         |
|:---------------------------------------------------------------|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Expression of nonconformity ‘Percent nonconforming’ (products) | Expression of nonconformity ‘Percent nonconforming’ (products)                                                                               |
| Classificati: f i iti assification of nonconformities          | JYSK and the supplier must agree on specific definitions of Critical, Major and Minor in accordance with 3 before initiating the inspection. |
| Acceptance Quality Level (AQL)                                 | According to 4.                                                                                                                              |

During the assessment of inspection results classifications according to Table 2 must be applied.

| Critical   | e Legal violations * Content of restricted substances e Breach of safety requirements                                                |
|:-----------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|
source: JYSK 8005 - Acceptance sampling according to AQL.pdf

content:
Major      | * Functional defects e Breach of agreed specifications and requirements * Nonconformities and defects that end-consumers will notice |
| Minor      | * Nonconformities and defects that end-consumers will not notice                                                                     |

During the assessment inspection results classifications according to Table 3 must be applied.

| Nonconformity classification:   | Acceptance Quality Limit (AQL):                                                                        | Unnamed: 2                                                              |
|:--------------------------------|:-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|:------------------------------------------------------------------------|
| Critical Unacceptable (AQL=0.0) | Critical Unacceptable (AQL=0.0)                                                                        | Critical Unacceptable (AQL=0.0)                                         |
| Maj ajor                        | ‘Average claim rate’ according to 4.1 rounded Note: ‘Standard AQL’ are: 0.065, 0.10, 0.15,             | to nearest ‘Standard AQL’ <4.0 0.25, 0.40, 0.65, 1.0, 1.5, 2.5 and 4.0. |
| Minor                           | e ‘GOLD’-products                                                                                      | 2.5                                                                     |
| Minor                           | e ‘PLUS’-products e ‘BASIC’-products e Products that are not quality rated (‘BASIC’, ‘PLUS’ or “GOLD’) | 4.0                                                                     |
source: JYSK 8005 - Acceptance sampling according to AQL.pdf

content:
The ‘Average claim rate’ must be calculated as the ‘Total claims %’ based on JYSK claim-statistics from stores:

• Based on similar products (If not otherwise agreed the applicable product group of the concerned product).

• Looking one year back.

• Cleaned for outliers such as product disposals initiated by JYSK.

The supplier must acknowledge the ‘Average claim rate’ before initiation of the deciding sampling.
